comments.body:
As I was going to say before I was so rudely interrupted by the word limit, we need these size variants to also reflect their environmental factors, like mineshafts closer to the surface would likely be dug out with greater ease and thus be larger, whilst those in the Deep dark or below y 0 would be dug from deepstone and likely smaller due to the greater resistance of the ground.

Additionally, mineshafts could have been constructed in areas rich in ores, resulting in a large size but also a lack or natural ores due to overmining, causing the player to descend further down through this network and getting this feel of risk vs reward along the way.

Treasure - 

Nothing excites me more than the thought of treasure, sure the journey is more important than the destination, but who doesn't love a chest full of gold or some artefacts left behind in a long abandoned mine system. Winches could be added as functional and flavourful contraptions in mines, when powered they lower a platform to either the first block below them or based on the Redstone signal strength they are given, they would add a cool machine to take home from your adventure and install in your home or own mines, whilst simultaneously making a lot of sense to be used in a mineshaft to get between levels.

That about sums it up, I have had a few new ideas writing this but I need to flesh the out a bit first, I hope this is seen and thanks for reading it!    (:
Just switch to peaceful or dont fight the warden at all if so afraid of it. No one's forcing you to kill it.

i agree,(unpopular oppion)  who like it don't have the same play style as me obviusly 500 hp with a ranged attack seems kinda dumb make it in the end citys or somthing so its post dragon where you can deal with taking a hit maybe 2 with a gold apple? make the end citys more interesting the overworld is also lower health to 250 hp total instead of the 500 or hoping theres an option to play without it becuase i like to challenge my self with no torch and shield runs i rather not torture my self with this update, the skulk shreikers can detect mining blocks though blocks so if you get really unlucky strip mining or makeing a "epic" underground base it may not be as easy to deal with so you have to freaking wait for it to despawn by leaving area and finding the darn skulk sensor garbage the summoned it in the first place blindness effect is annoying too greifing will be a problem as well becuase the warden can be summoned anywhere in the overworld so you just lose your levels to some "mean person" that put a sensor in your base warden changes the game way too much from my prospective so personally not a fan but if there a option to remove it from spawning then its all good if its still in the overworld then fine. but hopefully you understand that i need an option to not have it spawn in a new world i create at least people who want it can enjoy it but for me im just want to mine that sweet sweet deepslate so i can build "epic" castles/houses/ hiddenish and why i dont like it.

How about no and you don't have to go to the deep dark it's optional and by the way to all the people people and saying you could just build up nice try doing that lol I hope you like the new pre-release today because it goes through armor and enchantments so your fancy prop 4 armor isn't going to help you and don't you dare think about using Shields it goes through Shields and lava nice try it doesn't work and the warden shell gets stronger and I will enjoy every last second of it watching the people who think they could beat it get obliterated
Remove the Warden!
Switch to peaceful crybaby

To the people in the comments saying that it's as simple as just don't go looking to fight it and your fine, that's not the case. My friends and I have a server that we just updated with the new Wild update and already after only a couple days our entire town has a sculk infestation. There's nowhere to go that's safe, and the warden is going to be summoned to our village/base at any moment, and it's not as though we can simply run away from the sighting and not return, because it's our home. I would suggest not getting rid of the warden because obviously some like having it, but having a cheat where you can disable warden spawn like you can (or could, idk if you still can) phantoms. I personally don't enjoy that sort of gameplay, but the wonderful thing about minecraft I always felt was that it is diverse to be able to play according to personal preference. Now I feel as though I don't have a choice, and I'm nervous to continue playing because I don't want sculk to spawn every time I farm my animals (like they just did). Just some of my thoughts.

Warden is too dificult for the loot gained in the ancient city. Either nerf him or boost the loot. Chests are full of items you can find in random spawner dungeons....  rare crystal shards and rare broken music disk chunks is not enough.
skill issue
also there is a section in options called spawning where you can disable warden spawn if you dont like it.
If you can‚Äôt kill it, that‚Äôs more like a skill issue. Wardens aren‚Äôt meant to be killed anyways. Plus you can just sneak around or use wool
With the new terrain and cave generation, why not add new river generation too?

Flowing water generated over source blocks:

An alternative method to manage local water height changes, if considering river generation changes generally; compared to rocky rapids a full 8 blocks of flowing water generated over source blocks might look better for slow rivers. This might seem odd as it is difficult to make such as a player, but I expect players rarely modify natural rivers, and might prefer this to rapids in gradual height changes, especially if this made the water level changes navigable up-river.

To collect more information on river generation suggestions, there seems to be significant distributed support for updating surface/mountain river generation in a somewhat similar way, sometimes specifically in the caves/cliffs update:

Improvements to Rivers

River Biome: river source

Fix Mountain Rivers or Fix Rivers in General

Better lakes and rivers

River World Generation

Badlands (Canyon rivers)

Streams and rivers update

Better river, lakes and waterfalls

Rivers with varying water levels

As well as support for river caves:

Underground Rivers

And general river update suggestions:

Remodeled Rivers

River Deltas
yeah its really annoying when rivers cut a mountain in half and make you cross a huge gap

Hot springs would be a great idea, they would make a better connector between flooded caves and rivers then the awkward gaps in the ground currently used in the bedrock beta. Also, Mountain lakes fed by small creeks would be a Improvement from the gigantic cracks made by rivers.

Or, since dolphins actually use echolocation, it could work better in the water. At the very least, it should limit the sensor to only detecting things in the water, and sensors out of water can't detect sounds under the water

You can already limit the range ignoring signals above a certain level.

Maybe even increase the range underwater like a sonar.

Interesting concept. This seems incredibly useful when you want to detect a specific vibration in a set range without having to use a ton of wool occlusions to block vibrations with the same frequency outputs.
Technically speaking sound travels better through water than air.
Limit Levi sound and vibrations actually travel faster underwater than through the air so skulk sensors should have a longer range underwater.
Limit Levi sound and vibrations actually travel faster underwater than through the air so skulk sensors should have a longer range underwater.

I absolutely LOVE this idea.

Because...

  • It gives another use for amethysts
  • It would allow players to hear that beautiful twinkly sound (which could be used to make any place feel mystical)  

Not only that, but what if they were somehow dyable, or able to be changed in some way to make them have a slightly different sound and color.

I wouldn't think they'd be placed like pickles, rather, like lanterns, and perhaps they could glow (maybe when combined with glow squid ink?) 

I think this is a lovely idea, and I really hope the Mojang developers see it.
Other items could be attached to add different sounds

It would be nice to have Obsidian & Nautilus shell chimes, coral chimes, it'd be so neat to be able to add individual arrangement of the chimes with their own sounds... oh the possibilities...

These chimes are a great way to put more use into some of the resources that sit around in our chests collecting dust.

I love the idea that they tell you if it‚Äôs going to rain soon or the next day or something, having more chimes in random intervals like gusts of wind are coming in from the storm. Placing them on certain blocks could raise or lower pitch too like placing note blocks on certain blocks

Hatchlings could rest on the players shoulder or head once they have imprinted on them since they can‚Äôt fly. I‚Äôm not sure about this idea though but I‚Äôm open to suggestions.
Cool idea. In the spawning part, I think they should spawn in wooded mountains or regular mountains and as they fly they can move through several biomes and always come back to their nest

I agree, I think they should be most common in the Mountain Forests and the cliffs but Peregrine Falcons live in a lot of different places around the world so they should be able to spawn in other biomes as well.

Also I agree that they should be able to move throughout different biomes but if they are nesting then they shouldn‚Äôt be able to fly off to far similar to bees.

There nests should be able to spawn in any biome where there can be perches with a random number of eggs. These nests should be a fairly rare spawn. They should be able to attack chicken, rabbits, fish, bats, parrots, and baby animals. They should stay within around 100 blocks of their nests. You cannot gain loyalty from a naturally spawning one. They can gain loyalty from a baby falcon by regularly feeding it overtime. Additionally Falcons should be able to go at the max world height and detect mobs from 100 blocks down. When they attack they will dive directly down onto them. When loyal Falcons may go and rest on you, they may also bring you some of the loot from the mobs they hunted. Additionally when the falcon is nearby or above you and you are under attack by specific mobs the falcon will help fight them off by flying up and diving. You can get it to lay more eggs by feeding it and if a nest is close enough. I don't think the leather glove itself should nessessarilly be included though.

I love these ideas, especially the part about their good eyesight however I just want to make some things clear because I know I dint explain these well enough.

1. I meant to say Falcon hatchlings will imprint and become loyal to the nearest player when they hatch.

2. The perch I was talking about is a block that you make for the falcon like how you make bee hives for bees.

3. I wanted the leather glove to add some balence to the falcons but I can see how that limiting feature can be annoying.

That‚Äôs all :]
Maybe you can wear a Leather Tunic and then they will come perch on your shoulder like parrots?

It also fits with mojang's "endangered species awareness" mob adding (turtles, pandas, bees etc) they should also circle around in the sky when you release them to look for hostile mobs (prioritizing ones you have attacked) and attack the same way phantoms do.

Hey Jeb I know me tanking to you is like talking to a brick wall for I am no YouTuber nor am I important to the Minecraft community but well can your team pleas add a mushroom update pleas the biome has so much potential but it never gets what in need it only has the lonely Mooshrooms and no other spatial mobs not even the villager nor most minecrafters want to live there. from kaiturtle1.
Windchime sounds.
Maybe a higher chance and for longer!

Very good proposal. But not only luminous berries but also other types of food that when eating them there is the possibility of giving us an effect. For example, when we eat normal berries (the red ones) there is a very small possibility that it will give us the effect of speed; or beets, when we eat them that gives us an effect of resistance to fire. Thus, at the beginning of the game when potions cannot yet be made, these foods will no longer be useless and will be preferred by UHC players.
Makes sense!

I love the idea of being able to house snow golem wherever you want by using powered snow. It would mean being able to build snow farm at your base, even if you live in a mesa biome.

 

[On an unrelated note, this would actually work with a blaze farm. Blazes only drop blaze rods if it is killed by a player or a wolf. Still like the suggestion.]
I am glad to see I am not the only one who wants that! :D

I was about to make the same suggestion. Additionally, this interaction would be useful in shulker farm, since they are used to aggravate shulkers, which is necessary for farms like that. I really hope it will be looked into. regards.
Deffo need some darker wood options especially for doors and trapdoors. So many blackstone/deepslate variations. Dark Oak doors look too bright in comparison
I love your ideas on a dungeon update. I too made a post about updating structures in general but had not quite an idea on how to make dungeons better.

I likey!  The stick of dynamite could be crafted with two gunpowder, four paper, and one string.

Same, if you're going to add a cave update don't neglect the mineshafts, what I mean by this is bigger mineshafts because of how much room we have for caves,  I like the dynamite idea but maybe we could also add the miner's helmet

I have Minecraft Education edition for Bedrock Windows 10 version. I loved the 1.17.11 I had beautiful worlds with lovely mountains, and when 1.17.30 updated, It destroyed everything. I seriously like 1.17.11 better. Those were realistic mountains enough. I was wondering, how can we go back to that version? I downloaded a thing called TLaucher, but It did not work right at all. What can I do to downgrade back to 1.17.11? You should make a built in feature, that lets us choose what version we want, like there in play, marketplace .... then choose minecraft version. I am sure you can do that. Then we can choose 1.16.2 or 1.17.11 or 1.17.30, and so on.

Then don't go there. Removing the mob because you don't like it would ruin it for others who do like it. If you simply never go to fight the Warden, your Minecraft would basically be the same as before

unpopular opinion, but I agree. especially the "turns the game more into a hide-and-seek horror" part.

the fact that the creator of the warden used to be a modder and constantly tweets about horror games gives off the impression that he forgot that he's supposed to be working on Minecraft and not a Horror game (and imo those get really generic bc most of them are just copy-and-paste mechanics but that's besides the point).

the warden seems fine for a mod for like a new dimension, but as part of the official vanilla game it feels so alien in its mechanics. not coherent at all with the rest of the game that's where all the monsters, while possibly challenging, are meant to be killed by the player.
You don't have to go to the deep dark biome if you don't want to
I'm just gonna say that enchanted diamond armor are probably going to help you, if that is still uncomforting, try strip mining.
Darknessfrog makes a point. You aren't required to go down in the deep dark. Plus Mojang wanted to add in a terrifying mob so of course it will feel like a hide-and-seek horror.
No challenge means no fun and thrill
Well, the game needs more challenging features.
its a good mob plus its not gonna be that hard to kill you can just build up 4 block and kill it easily
killergamer294 Someone at Mojang said the Warden will have a trick up its sleeve to stop this. Not sure what it is yet but it'll be interesting to see.

I appreciate the comments that have been left. Unfortunately, not getting to explore a key part of the game closes off a lot of exploration, which is something I enjoy in Minecraft. Adding the wardens turns the game into something other than what it has been up until this point. Minecraft is not and should not play as a horror game. I'm all for new mobs and new challenges, but adding an unkillable mob (according to Mjoang, they don't want players to be able to kill them) adds a level of frustration and blocks off future updates for players like myself. There are plenty of games to go to if you want challenge, stealth, and horror. Minecraft always appealed to me specifically because it WASN'T those things. That's not to say it's not somewhat challenging, but it's a breath of fresh air compared to other games.

No, the 1.17 caves are so cool. There needs to be a threat. I do however have an idea about a strategy for the warden not to hear you. What would happen is that you would be able to walk on wool, place it or anything like that and the warden could not hear you. Plus in my opinion the warden adds more to the lore of the game.

Honest. Minecraft makes me panic a lot! You are not alone. And not just about 1.17. It does not really scare me but it makes me panic a lot. If you've been playing you know what I mean. So mayb the warden is a bit of a change to minecrafts usual self. If you think about it though things like ghasts and soul sand valley are scary (kind of because its minecraft) because they have things to do with ghosts. The illagers seem to be very sinister and angry at villagers because of the way they attack and also the fact pillagers just appear in that kind of area (along with their towers). The woodland mansion is also pretty similar to the other too. Minecraft can be like that. Especially when you just start. The Warden is just another thing like that.
ammaaya thats kind of the point

I strongly disagree. When I first play Minecraft, it was the fear and survival of the first night that got me interested. It was the dangers and challenges from exploring the world that makes exploring fun. I love this direction where Minecraft is going, with exciting powerful mobs that give me challenge, something to be scared of in the deep areas of the world. I actually want the Warden to be unkillable, so that it won't be just some random tough mob you farm for drops, but instead, something unique with unique mechanics.

Remember that if you just want to explore, you can turn on peaceful mode, or temporarily switch into easy mode if you want mob drops. Please don't ruin the fun out of other players who want challenging mobs.

I guess you dont go to the nether then right? Endless seas of lava and making water evaporate makes it unfair and doesnt fit with the theme of minecraft. Obviously nobody thinks like this. The deep dark is a choice to explore just like the nether is and if you stop obsessing over the fact that the warden is a mob then you will enjoy the feature more. The warden is intended to be a force of nature which is persistent not a sudden threat which you can easily* get rid of

I agree this getting out of hand.

Minecraft already has enough horror in it. herobrine creepy pasta, creepy cave sounds, sometimes dying without knowing what happened, losing all your stuff...

If you want a game where you run away from something feeling helpless go play fnaf or something

I want to build and craft things in the underground and not have to run away from some unkillable mob.

This also puts major griefing potential in the game for trolls

Also think of the children you might not realize it but young children get scared of things that you may think are fine.

Are we really going to put something like this in a game children play just to be creative?

If you want the warden to be hard to beat put yourself on hard difficulty

The 1.18 update and new terrain generation cuts down villages, desert temples and many more useful structures,and replaces them with oceans, so that is why I play on 1.17. I hoped that the 1.19 update would turn things round, but no, it makes them worse. Minecraft is a game where you are not ment to be spooked, and the warden defeats this rule. As well as this, it has the health of an enderdragon doubled and it is very hard to defeat. I play on peaceful and even though they don't spawn, players that want to challenge themselves to hardcore or hard difficulty, wont stand a chance against it, so the level for strip mining will be up to y level 5-9, which defeats the purpose of the deeper levels. 

Top tip: Dont update the game to 1.19 and it is best if you go to 1.16 or 1.17

tbh "you don't have to go there" is a pretty rubbish argument.

When you have new content, the first thing you are thinking about is going there to explore it, especially ancient cities, which are pretty well made.

Cool if they want to have a strong monster, but dont make it absurdly strong (high attack, far melee reach and ranged attack) and nearly invincible (though I found out that it can get stuck in low spaces and take damage from being stuck inside block - some people will find ways to make warden farms, if they havent already).

The whole counter argument of "just don't go there" is so dumb. The mob literally is antithetical to the idea of minecraft's biggest component: exploration. Making an UNKILLABLE mob that literally forces people who don't want to deal with it to stop exploring is such a strange thing to implement in Minecraft and very out of character :/
just use peaceful

People are commenting: ‚Äújust don‚Äôt go there‚Äù but thats not the point. I don‚Äôt want this in my world at all. If there was an option to turn it off that‚Äôd be great. Love the idea of new biomes and the lush caves but what on earth is the warden supposed to do? The loot in the city is kind of trash too. Less risk and better look raiding end cities. All the warden and deep dark does is make mining more stressful. New biome and new wood? Yes. More stress mining diamonds? NO. Now if the city had a portal‚Ä¶ and was post endgame‚Ä¶ and another dimension? Cool but thats not what it is right now and it serves no positive purpose. Except the skulk sensors. The redstone implications are excellent.

do like I do: /gamerule doWardenSpawning false... and you have all the content minus one tiny thing: the warden. The peacefull argument is rubbish... peacefull as we all fully well know is the hardest game setting: no gunpowder or tnt... no potion brewing... no end-dimension as the stronghold becomes impossible to locate in-game, etc. etc. Just remove the warden if you don't like it. The gamerule settings are there to be used... this is a sandbox game.
yeah but players on bedrock cant turn off the warden with gamerules.

To everyone that keeps saying, then just don't go there, your response is absolutely useless. Imagine if it was the other way around and only bedrock players could use a mob switch. I promise you'd be just as annoyed as us bedrockers. I'm not a keyboard guy whatsoever and the mods for using a controller on Java, and I mean all of them, are absolute garbage. The fact that there's any differences between the platforms is kinda the biggest pile of garbage ever. Why make a console version of the game if it's going to be so drastically different? It's just a tease. Like what? We're supposed to just avoid the biggest update the game has had in years all because it's completely different and 1000 times harder on bedrock than it is on java? What kind of response is that? A stupid one at best. The games should be 100% identical. And I often times think the devs completely disregard that minecraft is a sandbox game above everything else when they make patches or just choose to not implement exploits in bedrock that are the crowning jewels in java. At least make a 1-1 mod that allows console players to use a all system controllers compatible for Java. It's like we're being punished for preferring a controller over a massive and Cluny keyboard. All they did was divide a community that's supposed to be united. Bedrock version is like being on probation. You're legally not allowed to drink while you have to watch everyone else party and for some reason it's your fault.

Completely agree with OP. The warden is too strong, and not a good fit. It isn't even scary anymore, just annoying. "Don't go there" and "you're not meant to fight it" are cop out answers for a game that is directly centered around exploration. It seems most of the anti-warden posts I see are generally pretty well thought out, logical, reasonably written, etc. And the pro-warden posts are virtually all "git gud, lmao just don't go there, shift key, skill issue" etc. This thread which I am necroing is a perfect example.

The warden pretty much only exists because some people think it's cool and if you actually compile the facts, it is objectively a bad mechanic for this style of game.

I really need the warden mob for a custom survival Skywars Map.

Also you can kill the warden using a sword, lava, netherite Armor, and stacks of Enchanted gold Apples.
